name: v0.10.21
body:
## What's Changed

### New Features

This release adds support for a bunch of new resources: 102 have been added in total! üöÄ This breaks down into:
* 7 new paid Azure resources
* 49 new free Azure resources
* 1 new paid AWS resource
* 45 new free AWS resources

We've also had 2 new contributors contribute towards this release. Thank you @hash-sha512 and @ABaboshin! üôè 

#### Azure Resources

* Add support for Azure Event Grid by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2421
* Add support for Azure `mssql_managed_instance` resource by @grixxie in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2393
* Add support for Azure Network Watcher by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2425
* Add support for Microsoft Defender for Cloud by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2423

#### AWS Resources

* Add support for AWS OpenSearch support by @ABaboshin in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2415

#### Google Resources

* Add support for Provisioned IOPS for `google_compute_disk` resource by @hash-sha512 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2408
* Add support for `pd-extreme` and `hyperdisk-extreme` disk types for `google_compute_disk` resource by @hash-sha512 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2408

#### Free resources

* Add more free AWS and Azure resource by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2418 https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2428

### Fixes

* Get correct price for AWS RDS gp3 volumes by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2424
* Fix North America same continent egress prices for `google_container_registry` by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2431
* Fix sanitization of Azure pull request URL in Infracost output metadata by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2426

## Docs

https://github.com/infracost/docs/pull/445

## New Contributors
* @hash-sha512 made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2408
* @ABaboshin made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2415

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.10.20...v0.10.21

name: v0.10.20
body:
# Infracost v0.10.20

In this release, we've introduced new Azure resources, improved support for global AWS resource references, and addressed various fixes and enhancements! üöÄ

## New Features

* Added support for `azurerm_logic_app_integration_account` [#2397](https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2397)
* Added support for Azure SignalR Service [#2399](https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2399)
* Added support for Azure Traffic Manager [#2401](https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2401)

## Enhancements

* Improved module loading errors as project error metadata [#2382](https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/)
* Added default variables for Infracost config template files [#2394](https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2394)
* Fixed read operation lookups for Azure storage accounts [#2412](https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2412)

## Fixes

* Resolved nil panic coming from protected VM being nil when the resource references are incomplete [#2381](https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2381)
* Added support for name as a global AWS resource reference [#2409](https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2409)
* Suppressed warnings and sync messages when logging [#2410](https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2410)
* Fixed egress and storage costs for GCP [#2413](https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2413)

Full Changelog: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.10.19...v0.10.20

name: v0.10.17
body:
# 0.10.17 (Feb 07 2023)

Infracost version `0.10.17` includes several enhancements and bug fixes aimed at helping users with complex setups. This version has improved support for module evaluation, error reporting, and pricing lookups. Give it a try!

## New features
* Augment the infracost comment command to allow passing client certificates for GitHub Enterprise Servers that require them - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2256
* Add support for absolute file paths for Terraform variable files, offering greater flexibility for projects and helping users with a top-level global variable file directory - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2279
* Scope CLI run errors by project, so that multi-project runs no longer fail at the first error. Instead, they report aggregated errors at the end of the run, as shown in the example below:
  ```bash
  Project: infracost/infracost/cmd/infracost/testdata/breakdown_multi_project_with_error/dev
  Module path: dev
  
  Errors:
    Error loading Terraform modules:
       failed to inspect module path testdata/breakdown_multi_project_with_error/dev diag:
         Invalid block definition:
           Either a quoted string block label or an opening brace ("{") is expected here. (and 1 other messages)
  
  ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ‚îÄ
  Project: infracost/infracost/cmd/infracost/testdata/breakdown_multi_project_with_error/prod
  Module path: prod
  
   Name                                                   Monthly Qty  Unit   Monthly Cost 
                                                                                           
   aws_instance.web_app                                                                    
   ‚îú‚îÄ Instance usage (Linux/UNIX, on-demand, m5.8xlarge)          730  hours     $1,121.28 
   ‚îú‚îÄ root_block_device                                                                    
   ‚îÇ  ‚îî‚îÄ Storage (general purpose SSD, gp2)                        50  GB            $5.00 
   ‚îî‚îÄ ebs_block_device[0]                                                                  
      ‚îú‚îÄ Storage (provisioned IOPS SSD, io1)                    1,000  GB          $125.00 
      ‚îî‚îÄ Provisioned IOPS                                         800  IOPS         $52.00 
                                                                                           
   Project total                                                                 $1,303.28 
  
   OVERALL TOTAL                                                                 $1,303.28 
  ```
  by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2225 and @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2268

### AWS

* Add support for Lambda ARM architectures - by @robh007 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2269
* Add support for `ap-southeast-4` region - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2280

## Enhancements

* Improve the macOS/Linux installer script to allow downloading any version. For example: `export INFRACOST_VERSION=v0.10.16; curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/infracost/infracost/master/scripts/install.sh | sh` - by @sylwit in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2251
* Remove sensitive variables from evaluation warnings, so that variables such as foo_token no longer trigger CLI warnings - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2271
* Add retry logic to Terraform Cloud variable loading. This improves fall over logic for cases where Terraform Cloud API returns a malformed response/code - by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2272
* Add backoff logic to pricing API requests, meaning that slow or malformed Pricing API responses won't kill a CLI run -  by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2248

## Fixes
* Module `for_each` attributes were not expanding correctly if they relied on a referenced expanded module. This improvement will benefit users who heavily rely on composable modules - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2232
* Change project paths to absolute path if initial `--config-file` path is abs. This fixes a regression that prevented GitHub action workflows building cost estimates - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2234
* `infracost comment` hiding module path when projects are skipped - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2240
* Reload ModuleCall when `each.value` changes. This resolves bugs where the incorrect module inputs were passed before the references were expanded - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2241
* Copy `CoreResource` before costing policy, preventing resource outputs being changed when reporting cost estimates to the CLI - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2246

### Azure
* Mark MSSQL database as free when its SKU is ElasticPool - by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2253
* Repair price lookup for API Management - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2267
* SQL server cost component lookup - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2275
* Application Gateway v2 costs - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2278

## New Contributors
* @sylwit made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2251

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.10.16...v0.10.17

name: v0.10.16
body:
## What's Changed
v0.10.16 contains various fixes and enhancements, including improvements related to our [GitHubApp](https://www.infracost.io/docs/integrations/github_app/).

Infracost has now changed behaviour to add .infracost folder at the working directory for the infracost execution and not the sub project folders. Users might run Infracost in these sub project folders in isolation.

### Enhancements
* Change module download directory to reside at context root by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2208
* Add support for ZRS managed disks to Azure  by @grixxie in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2153
* Run auto-detected projects in parallel by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2209
* Change search depth to 10 when use all paths is set by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2210
* Add configuration settings for actual usage by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2194
* Update --terraform-use-state to auto init if needed by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2221

### Fixes
* fix: use concurrent safe map in fetcher by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2213
* fix: default to the correct default provider based on the resource type by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2212
* fix: nested map keys for terragrunt deps output by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2214
* fix: ensure excluded paths are not evaluated by Terragrunt by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2215
* fix: panic arising from cty conversion of cty.NilVal by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2216
* fix: parse Terragrunt var files from extra args block by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2218
* fix: array notation causing issues with mocking terragrunt deps by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2217
* fix: fix object variables passed with a subset of keys by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2220
* fix: add usagetype filter to cw metric alarm by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2226

## New Contributors
* @grixxie made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2153

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.10.15...v0.10.16

name: v0.10.15
body:
## What's Changed

Infracost v0.10.15 contains fixes for critical issues facing Terragrunt users. It also resolves minor regressions introduced in 0.10.14 and improves our [GitHub app](https://www.infracost.io/docs/integrations/github_app/) functionality.

### Fixes

* Increase max context iterations whilst parsing Terraform modules, resolving issues faced by users of complex third-party modules that were exiting before being properly evaluated -  by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2174
* Merge Terraform outputs with output mocks built with regular expression, solving the longstanding `invalid character ',' looking for beginning of value` bug that Terragrunt users faced if output expressions from dependencies could not be resolved - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2175
* Skip unsupported node pools as Google Container Cluster sub-resources. This resolves a runtime panic caused by nil sub-resources. by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2184

## Improvements
* Add cache for Terragrunt source files. Significantly speeding up Terragrunt HCL evaluation by caching already downloaded modules and copying them to a destination if they are included again - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2183
* Initial support to track git changes in project metadata, improving our [GitHub app](https://www.infracost.io/docs/integrations/github_app/)) functionality to only show projects in the PR comment that have VCS changes - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2182

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.10.14...v0.10.15

name: v0.10.14
body:
## What's Changed

Infracost v0.10.14 contains a number of new resource pricing including support for Google custom machine types! It also includes some CLI features for allowing region overrides and showing the breakdown of all projects in a CI/CD comment.

### New features

CLI functionality:
* Add ability to override region via ENV var by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2123
* Add `--show-all-projects` flag to show all projects in table of `infracost comment` by @fatihtokus in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2087
* Add `--include-all-paths` flag for auto detection by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2127
* Allow `--terraform-use-state` flag with `--config-file` by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2104

This release also contains functionality to enable features on Infracost Cloud:
* Jira integration (available now) - see pull request cost estimates in Jira issues
* Guardrails (upcoming) - get alerted when pull requests pass a certain cost increase threshold
* Reports (upcoming) - get a daily/weekly summary of pull request costs
* Cost policies (upcoming) - add custom cost policies to your Terraform repositories, i.e. use gp3 volumes instead of gp2.

New resource prices:
* Google Compute custom machine types by @7onn in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2004
* AWS FSx OpenZFS File System (`aws_fsx_openzfs_file_system`) by @jgrumboe in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2092
* Azure Attestation Provider (`azurerm_attestation_provider`) by @yogeshCt3 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2134
* AWS Lambda tiered pricing by @robh007 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2137
* AWS EC2 host (`aws_ec2_host`) by @robh007 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2135

New regions:
* AWS eu-central-2 by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2128
* AWS eu-south-2 by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2140
* AWS ap-south-2 by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2148

### Fixes

* Fix S3 bucket "No products found for Lifecycle transition" in us-east 2 by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2100
* Fix GitHub comment truncation when it's too long by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2119
* Fix AWS RDS instance price lookups by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2132
* Fix AWS EFS file system resource price lookups by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2152
* Fix Azure Kubenertes cluster to use min_count for node pool size if node_count not specified by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2136
* Fix `depends_on` block causing module to re-evaluate with HCL parsing in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2122
* Fix pass fresh evaluation lookup map to child module evaluation by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2170
* Fix optional object keys not working with HCL parsing by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2173

### Dependencies

  * Bump `golang.org/x/text` and  `golang.org/x/net` by @peterdeme in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2106
  * Bump github.com/zclconf/go-cty-yaml from 1.0.2 to 1.0.3 by @dependabot in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2154
  * Bump github.com/hashicorp/hcl/v2 from 2.14.1 to 2.15.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2158
  * Bump github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/ec2 from 1.72.1 to 1.74.0 by @dependabot in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2161
  * Bump github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/ec2 from 1.74.0 to 1.74.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2169
  * Bump github.com/pterm/pterm from 0.12.49 to 0.12.50 by @dependabot in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2155
  * Bump github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/s3 from 1.27.11 to 1.29.5 by @dependabot in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2168
  * Bump github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/autoscaling from 1.23.16 to 1.24.1 by @dependabot in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2133
  * Bump github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/autoscaling from 1.24.1 to 1.24.3 by @dependabot in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2162
  * Bump github.com/aws/aws-sdk-go-v2/service/cloudwatch from 1.21.6 to 1.21.11 by @dependabot in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2145

name: v0.10.12
body:
## What's Changed Infracost **0.10.12** brings additional features that help simplify and debug users' workflows. --- ## New Features * New environment variables giving users the option to configure Infracost output currency and format. The below example show the output of the number `64145.4525` with different formatting options: | Environment variables | Output for 64145.4525 | |------------------------------------------------------------------------------|-----------------------| | INFRACOST_CURRENCY=USD
INFRACOST_CURRENCY_FORMAT="USD: 1.234,567890 $" | `64.145,452500 $` | | INFRACOST_CURRENCY=EUR
INFRACOST_CURRENCY_FORMAT="EUR: 1.234,56‚Ç¨" | `64.145,45‚Ç¨` | | INFRACOST_CURRENCY=GBP
INFRACOST_CURRENCY_FORMAT="GBP: ¬£ 1,234.567" | `¬£ 64,145.453` | by @fatihtokus in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2017 * The Infracost usage file now allows users to provide defaults for resource types. Resource type defaults apply to all resources of that type regardless of the module they reside in. This is useful when you want to create traffic profiles such as small/medium/large. Resource type defaults can be overridden on a per-resource basis (shown below); usage keys that are re-defined at a resource level override the default, and new usage keys are merged with the defaults. ```yaml aws_dynamodb_table: storage_gb: 1000 # Set in all DynamoDB table resources aws_dynamodb_table.my_table: monthly_write_request_units: 200 # Merged with default that defines storage_gb aws_dynamodb_table.my_other_table: storage_gb: 50 # Overrides the default ``` by @balazs-marjan in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1979 You can read more about the use cases and options [on our docs](https://www.infracost.io/docs/features/usage_based_resources/#usage-profiles). * Support for HCL warnings in project metadata. This means that your Infracost Cloud runs will now contain useful information about missing configuration that could be affecting your cost estimates. ![SCR-20220928-k4o](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6455139/192810764-a646eb7e-05b0-46f6-a970-a0b432f39f66.png) by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2037 * Experimental support for Infracost Cloud based usage estimates, populated from live CUR data. More on this soon. - by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2050 ## Fixes * Fix project name generation from complex URLs - by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2016 ## New Contributors * @balazs-marjan made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1979 * @fatihtokus made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2017 **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.10.11...v0.10.12

name: v0.10.11
body:
## What's Changed

Infracost **0.10.11** contains significant updates to improve VCS detection. In addition, we've added the ability to override detection, which enables users to specify how they want their VCS data displayed in Infracost Cloud.

Users should be aware that with **0.10.11** release, the `vcsRepoUrl` metadata attribute has been changed to `vcsRepositoryUrl`:

```diff
{
    "vcsPullRequestUrl": "https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/42",
-   "vcsRepoUrl": "https://github.com/infracost/infracost.git",
+   "vcsRepositoryUrl": "https://github.com/infracost/infracost.git",
    "vcsProvider": "github",
    "vcsBaseBranch": "master",
    "vcsPullRequestTitle": "Some PR title",
    "vcsPullRequestId": "4321" 
    ...
}
```

## Infracost Cloud enhancements:

* Infracost CLI has improved metadata support, meaning more platforms and deployment systems work out of the box with Infracost Cloud. Additional VCS environment variables have also been added to the CLI. Users can use these to override Infracost VCS detection. A complete list of supported environment variables is below - see [our docs for examples](https://www.infracost.io/docs/features/environment_variables/#environment-variables-to-override-metadata):
  ```
  - `INFRACOST_VCS_PROVIDER`: can be "github", "gitlab", "azure_repos" or "bitbucket"
  - `INFRACOST_VCS_REPOSITORY_URL`: HTTPS URL of the repository, e.g. "https://github.com/infracost/example-terraform"
  - `INFRACOST_VCS_PULL_REQUEST_URL`: HTTP URL of the pull request, e.g. "https://github.com/alikhajeh1/example-terraform/pull/2"
  - `INFRACOST_VCS_PULL_REQUEST_AUTHOR`: author username or full name of the pull request, e.g. "john190" or "John Smith"
  - `INFRACOST_VCS_PULL_REQUEST_TITLE`: title of the pull request, e.g. "Increase IOPS"
  - `INFRACOST_VCS_BRANCH`: name of the branch that was used to generate the estimate, e.g. "increase_iops"
  - `INFRACOST_VCS_COMMIT_SHA`: long commit SHA of the branch that was used to generate the estimate, e.g. "1af413ad15ad6cbdfca667361231231231231231"
  - `INFRACOST_VCS_COMMIT_MESSAGE`: the commit message, e.g. "use m5.large"
  - `INFRACOST_VCS_COMMIT_TIMESTAMP`: unix epoch timestamp of the commit, e.g. `1661801540`. You can use the following command to get the timestamp on the latest commit from the current branch `export INFRACOST_VCS_COMMIT_TIMESTAMP=$(git show -s --format=%ct)`
  - `INFRACOST_VCS_COMMIT_AUTHOR_EMAIL`: git email of author of the commit, e.g. "john@company.com"
  - `INFRACOST_VCS_COMMIT_AUTHOR_NAME`: git author name of the commit, e.g. "John Smith"
  - `INFRACOST_VCS_PIPELINE_RUN_ID`: a way to differentiate pipelines that are run within one CI/CD run, this is the top-level pipeline ID, not individual jobs/runs within it, e.g. "2846680866"
  ```
  by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1990
* A new [`infracost upload` command](https://www.infracost.io/docs/features/cli_commands/#upload-runs) which supports uploading an Infracost JSON file to Infracost Cloud without the need for `infracost comment`. This command uploads the data regardless of your Org Settings or the `INFRACOST_ENABLE_CLOUD` environment variable. - by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1997

## New Features
 * Support for me-central-1, Middle East (UAE) region - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/2001

## Fixes
 * Support case-insensitive Azure VM sizes - by @mnaghavi in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1994
 * Update `go-git` dependency to fix panics reported by Windows users - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1989
 * Handle nested local object types when parsing HCL - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1972
 * Use correct object values when merging object context values - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1972
 * Fix Terragrunt parsing failure caused by incorrect assume role behaviour - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1977
 * Update `azurerm_function_app` and  `azurerm_mysql_flexible_server` price filters so they no longer show zero prices - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1992

## New Contributors
* @mnaghavi made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1994

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.10.10...v0.10.11

name: v0.10.8
body: # 0.10.8 (July 20 2022) Infracost **v0.10.8** adds support for [Infracost Cloud](https://www.infracost.io/docs/infracost_cloud/get_started/), our new hosted service. üéâ üéâ üö¢ It enables team leads, managers and FinOps practitioners to have visibility across all cost estimates in CI/CD and answer questions like: 1. What are the top pull requests that will increase/decrease costs the most? Who is working on them? 2. What were all the pull requests to the main branch on the date we had a spike in cloud costs? As part of this, we've removed the `infracost register` command in favour of `infracost auth login`, which uses our new login flow. This will not impact existing users or existing API keys. This release also contains several critical bug fixes for the CLI that have arisen from Infracost's [VSCode extension support](https://github.com/infracost/vscode-infracost). --- ## New features * AWS, Azure & GCP VMs now support a `monthly_hrs` usage field - by @jessecureton in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1812 * Bitbucket output/commend commands now include a `--exclude-cli-output` option. Allowing users to truncate long Bitbucket comments - by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1881 * Structured logging support. All Infracost commands now have a `--debug-report` flag, which generates a rich JSON debugging report. This helps Infracost maintainers debug problems quickly - @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1808 ### Azure * IoT Hub support - by @sawyerw-mastery in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1850 * Virtual Network peering support - by @sawyerw-mastery in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1852 ## Fixes * Updated path variables for Terraform file functions. This fixes problems with users trying to load files in child modules - by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1849 * Tweaked product filters for Google Storage Bucket - by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1868 * Better automatic project name detection - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1878 * Several panic and runtime errors caused by incomplete VSCode Terraform files * Parser index panic - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1861 * Azure VM scale set panic when resource has no `storage_profile_os_disk` block - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1864 * Entry in nil map panic - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1865 * Use a safer methods for type conversion - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1866 * Remove providing `cty.NilVal` to HCL expressions when in a partial evaluation state - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1867 ## New Contributors * @jessecureton made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1812 * @sawyerw-mastery made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1850 **Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.10.7...v0.10.8 ---

name: v0.10.7
body:
# 0.10.7 (July 08 2022)
Infracost **v0.10.7** adds a few outstanding features that have long been missing from the Infracost CLI. With this release, more users can now use Infracost CLI to get cloud estimates for their Terraform projects. üí™ 

## New features

* Support for JSON input variable files. The `--terraform-var-file` flag now accepts valid `tfvars.json` files - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1831
* Support for private Terraform registry modules. Users can now see prices for `module` blocks using a private registry `source` - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1781
* Support for `oracle-se2-cdb` and `oracle-ee-cdb` RDS engine types - by @philharle in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1793
 
## Fixes
* Load remote variables if TFC workspace is set to agent execution mode - by @jgrumboe in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1787
* Various fixes for crashes and nil pointers because of empty configuration blocks:
  * AWS DMS resource throwing nil pointer if `replication_instance_class` is the wrong format - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1794
  * Index out of range panic when `storage_os_disk` is not set on `virtual_machine` - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1810
  * Mock attribute overriding the default location, meaning prices are shown as $0 - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1836
  * Blank `geo_locations` causing panic errors for `azurerm_cosmosdb_cassandra_keyspace` - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1838

## New Contributors
* @philharle made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1793

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.10.6...v0.10.7

name: v0.10.6
body:
## 0.10.6 (June 28 2022)
Infracost **v0.10.6** contains a few minor fixes for upcoming features soon to have general availability.

### Fixes
* Remove sending project context to dashboard - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1777
* Introduce keyed mutex to wait for a `clone` to finish before access - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1782

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.10.5...v0.10.6

name: v0.10.5
body:
## 0.10.5 (June 23 2022)
Infracost **v0.10.5** fixes a regression introduced in the **v0.10.4** release. Upgrading an underlying Terragrunt library caused some users to have a sharp increase in the time it took for Infracost to process their projects. Thank you to @dgokcin for your quick work in reporting this issue.  

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.10.4...v0.10.5

name: v0.10.4
body:
## 0.10.4 (June 23 2022)
Infracost **v0.10.4** improves Infracost's ability to evaluate Terraform files with missing contextual information. Improved expression support enhances user experience and cleans up several fatal errors that hindered CLI performance. We've also added a heavily requested `--project-name` flag, allowing users to generate friendly names for their projects.

**A note for Terragrunt users**: Infracost's JSON metadata for Terragrunt projects will now show `path` as relative to the run directory. This makes it consistent with Terraform projects.

### New Features

* Add a new `--project-name` flag and name config field that allows users to customise the project name. `--project-name` enables users to give projects a user-friendly name rather than displaying the project path. It also enables users to "group" projects under a `project-name` bucket. The project output is now changed to include the project name if specified, e.g.:
  ```diff
  Project: my friendly project
  Module path path/to/project/terraform
  Workspace: my-workspace

  ~ aws_instance.web_app
    -$561 ($1,303 ‚Üí $743)

      ~ Instance usage (Linux/UNIX, on-demand, m5.8xlarge ‚Üí m5.4xlarge)
        -$561 ($1,121 ‚Üí $561)

  Monthly cost change for my workspace project (Module path: ../../../../examples/terraform, Workspace: ws1)
  Amount:  -$561 ($1,303 ‚Üí $743)
  Percent: -43% 
  ```
  by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1759
* Add support for `AWSGlobalAccelerator` - by @carmeloriolo in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1721
* Add VCS metadata to project output. Additional metadata allows users who store historic runs to identify useful VCS data when analysing. New fields are listed below:
  ```
      "infracostCommand": the command associated with the run, one of breakdown, diff, output or comment
      "branch":  name of the branch that was used to generate the estimate
      "commit": long commit SHA of the branch that was used to generate the estimate
      "commitAuthorName": git author name of the commit
      "commitAuthorEmail": git email of author of commit
      "commitTimestamp": timestamp of the commit, ISO 8601 UTC string
      "commitMessage": the commit message
      "vcsProvider": name of the VCS provider (github, gitlab, azure_repos, bitbucket)
      "vcsBaseBranch": name of the base branch that the pull request is being merged into
      "vcsPullRequestTitle": name of the pull request
      "vcsPullRequestUrl": link to the pull request
      "vcsPullRequestID": the unique identifier of the pull request for the vcsProvider
      "vcsPullRequestAuthor": name of the person who opened the pull request, this is probably the same as commitAuthor most of the time but it's helpful to see this if they're different
      "vcsPipelineRunId": a way to differentiate pipelines that are run within one PR, this is the top-level pipeline ID, not individual jobs/runs within it.
  ```
  by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1758

### Fixes

* Update internals to use v3 azure provider - by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1763
* Set environment vars on Terragrunt run options, which enables `get_env` function to work correctly. - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1764
* Add dummy return types for attributes that cannot evaluate. Mock return values enable expressions that rely on attributes/data that isn't available to HCL (e.g. populated from the cloud) to function correctly.
This fixes several cases for Terragrunt users using `dependency` blocks with outputs that relied on expressions that Infracost could not evaluate. - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1723
* Properly handle `count` values set as a constant string rather than a number. Infracost now supports attributes like `count = "2"`. - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1769
* Fixes `azure_mssql_database` fatal error when an explicit `sku` is not set -  by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1771

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.10.3...v0.10.4

name: v0.10.2
body:
## 0.10.2 (June 08 2022)

Infracost **v0.10.2** contains fixes for regressions that were introduced in **v0.10.1**. This release should provide a more stable experience to users, we recommend you upgrade as soon as you can.

Please note: HCL parsing continues to struggle with Terragrunt support, we are actively working on fixing these issues. Users who continue to have difficulties with Terragrunt please see [this issue](https://github.com/infracost/infracost/issues/1695) for a workaround. Please report any ongoing problems so that we can fix them as soon as possible.

---

### Fixes

* Resolves a problem with multiple `exclude-path` flags being used - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1714
* Fix panics originating from `cty.Null` values - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1716
* Match downloaded modules based on key, solving "Failed to load module" error - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1731
* Fix included Terragrunt dependency blocks with same name overwriting the parent - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1733
* Change Azure product filters after Azure API changes - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1734

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.10.1...v0.10.2

name: v0.10.1
body:
## 0.10.1 (June 01 2022)

Infracost **v0.10.1** contains several fixes for Terragrunt users struggling to run Infracost with HCL parsing. Users who continue to have difficulties with Terragrunt please see [this issue](https://github.com/infracost/infracost/issues/1695) for a workaround. Please report any ongoing problems so that we can fix them as soon as possible.

---

### New Features

* `breakdown` and `diff` now support a `--exclude-path` flag to ignore directories. This is particularly useful when running Infracost in a multi-project environment or Terragrunt setup - @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1702
* Add elasticache support for reserved instances - @carmeloriolo in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1677
---

### Fixes

* Resolved several issues that Infracost had evaluating Terragrunt `dependency` blocks - @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1687
* Fixed an unhandled panic originating from incorrect slice index in `azurerm_application_gateway` - @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1686
* Rectified a problem where users could not run sync usage if using Elastic Beanstalk Environment - @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1696
* Fixed issue where nested `module` blocks in HCL that used inputs from `module` outputs received a nil value - @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1697

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.10.0...v0.10.1

name: v0.10.0
body:
## What's new?

Back in February 2022, we started an experiment to estimate costs by parsing Terraform HCL code directly. We're excited to announce that the experiment worked! So in v0.10 we've removed the experimental `--terraform-parse-hcl` flag and made HCL parsing the default behavior.

Going forward, we'll support two ways to run Infracost with Terraform via `--path`:
1. **Parsing HCL code (directory)**: this is the default and recommended option as it has the following 5 key benefits.
    ```shell
    # Terraform variables can be set using --terraform-var-file or --terraform-var
    infracost breakdown --path /code
    ```
2. **Parsing plan JSON file**: this will continue to work as before.
    ```shell
    cd /code
    terraform init
    terraform plan -out tfplan.binary
    terraform show -json tfplan.binary > plan.json

    infracost breakdown --path plan.json
    ```

### 1. Faster CLI

Infracost can now generate cost estimates *without* needing a Terraform plan. This removes our dependency on the Terraform binary altogether, which means no more `terraform init` or `terraform plan`.

That, in turn, means a super-fast CLI: Infracost used to take around 50 seconds to run on our internal Terraform mono-repo, that's now reduced to 2 seconds. üöÄ

### 2. No cloud creds needed

Running `terraform plan` requires users to have cloud credentials and Terraform secrets. The main reason we created the Infracost CLI first, instead of a web API, was so it could parse the Terraform plan JSON locally to extract cost-related parameters (e.g. instance type). Thus credentials and secrets were *not* sent anywhere.

Whilst this worked and was safe, it still posed a question: *is there a way to avoid setting credentials or secrets altogether?* Removing our dependency on `terraform plan` gave us a way to do that.

### 3. Cost estimates everywhere

Not needing cloud credentials, or even knowledge of how to generate a Terraform plan, means that *any engineer* who has access to code repos can generate cost estimates!

This also opens the door for cost estimates to be put everywhere: Infra-as-Code repo readmes, Terraform module readmes, Visual Studio, and even in continuous integration systems where a Terraform plan does not exist (not everyone runs Terraform via continuous deployment systems).

To make `infracost diff` work without a Terraform plan, we introduced a new `--compare-to infracost-base.json` flag. This enables a git-based cost diff to be produced, e.g.:
```shell
git checkout main
infracost breakdown --path /code --format json --out-file infracost-base.json

git checkout my-branch
infracost diff --path /code --compare-to infracost-base.json
```

### 4. Compare Infracost runs

The `infracost diff` command can now also be used to compare Infracost runs. Assuming you generated the files `infracost-last-week.json` and `infracost-today.json` using the `infracost breakdown --path /code --format json` command, you can compare them using:

```shell
infracost diff --path infracost-today.json --compare-to infracost-last-week.json
```

### 5. Detect multi-project repos

Setting the `--path` flag to a top-level repo directory will now attempt to process all projects automatically by:
1. Looking at the specified path or in any of the subdirectories with a depth less than 5.
2. Processing Terraform variable files with the `.auto.tfvars` extension (similar to what Terraform does).
3. Processing environment variables with a `TF_VAR_` prefix (similar to what Terraform does).

If this does not work for your use-case, use a [config-file](/docs/features/config_file/) and run `infracost breakdown --config-file=infracost.yml`, for example:
```yaml
# infracost.yml
version: 0.1
projects:
  - path: prod
    terraform_var_files:
      - prod.tfvars
      - us-east.tfvars

  - path: dev
    terraform_var_files:
      - dev.tfvars
```

## Migration guides

üëâüëâüëâ See [**the migration guides**](https://www.infracost.io/docs/guides/v0.10_migration/#migrations-guides) in the docs for migrating specific CI systems to use the new v0.10 Infracost version.

## Removed functionality

See [this docs section](https://www.infracost.io/docs/guides/v0.10_migration/#removed-functionality).

## Known issues

See [this docs section](https://www.infracost.io/docs/guides/v0.10_migration/#known-issues).

## Other changes

### New resources

#### Google
* Support for `google_compute_per_instance_config` by @golgeek in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1645
* Support for `google_compute_region_per_instance_config` by @golgeek in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1657

#### AWS

* Support for reservation in `db_instance` by @carmeloriolo in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1653

### Enhancements

* Add a better error message for errors originating from the Terragrunt libs by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1666
* Add breakdown path hint by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1673
* Fallback to the workspace defined by TF env for remote var loading by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1679
* Enable `-no-color` option by default for CI by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1628

### Fixes

* Redis instance monthly pricing by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1627
* Mark azure b1 type machine as free  by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1629
* Resolve SNS Topic notification price filters by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1633
* Solve support for references with for_each by @golgeek in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1640
* Rework reference mapping by @golgeek in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1660
* Computation of local scratch disk in GCP by @golgeek in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1655
* MSSQL Database License Type retrieval by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1664
* Update GCE inter-region egress filter by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1674
* Show only one cost component for Google Compute Address by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1639

### New Contributors
* @golgeek made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1640
* @carmeloriolo made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1653

We also want to give a massive thank you to every community member who has helped us with any HCL parsing issues by reporting them and helping us reproduce them. Finding these issues would not have been possible without this :tada:.

name: v0.10.0-beta.1
body:

name: v0.9.24
body:
# 0.9.24 (May 04 2022)

Infracost v0.9.24 fixes minor inconsistencies we released in v0.9.23. The most important being the `--compare-to` flag is now exclusive to the `diff` command. Thank you to all the fantastic community members who helped us try out the interim interface and gave your feedback.

## Infracost `diff` using `--compare-to`

The `diff` command `--compare-to` flag enables you to compare different Infracost runs (using their JSON output), for example:

```
git clone https://github.com/infracost/example-terraform.git

cd example-terraform/sample1

# Generate JSON file from an Infracost run
infracost breakdown --path . --terraform-parse-hcl --format json --out-file infracost-run.json

# Update the Terraform code by changing the instance type to m5.8xlarge
vim main.tf

# Show cost estimate diff
infracost diff --path . --terraform-parse-hcl --compare-to infracost-run.json
```

Read more about this behaviour [in our docs](https://www.infracost.io/docs/features/cli_commands/#option-1-terraform-directory-1)

### Relevant changes

* Update `--compare-to` flag to only be used by diff -  by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1620

## New resources
*  Add Azure Sentinel support - by @acald-creator in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1527

## Fixes
* Remove failing spinner if workspace does not use remote execution - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1622

## New Contributors
* @acald-creator made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1527 üéâ  ü•≥ 

## Announcements

The HCL parsing method will become the default behavior of the `infracost breakdown` and `infracost diff` commands in **v0.10.0** of the CLI. We haven't finalized the interface yet, but it's likely that the `--terraform-parse-hcl` flag will be removed so there will be two main ways to use Infracost:
- Option 1: Terraform directory‚Äã (good for source control systems such as GitHub)
- Option 2: Terraform plan JSON‚Äã (good for deployment systems such as Terraform Cloud)

## Docs
https://github.com/infracost/docs/pull/215

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.9.23...v0.9.24

name: v0.9.23
body:
# 0.9.23 (April 29 2022)

Infracost v0.9.23 contains support for parsing HCL with Terraform Cloud remote execution mode, TF_VAR_ env variables and Terragrunt. There's also a new `--compare-to` flag that enables you to compare different Infracost runs üöÄ
Thank you to our amazing community members who helped us diagnose, triage and fix bugs, you rock!

---

## Faster and simpler way to run Infracost

The `infracost breakdown --terraform-parse-hcl` experimental flag received very positive feedback, so we also added it to `infracost diff`! We also added a new `--compare-to` flag that enables you to compare different Infracost runs (using their JSON output), for example:
```
git clone https://github.com/infracost/example-terraform.git

cd example-terraform/sample1

# Generate JSON file from an Infracost run
infracost breakdown --path . --terraform-parse-hcl --format json --out-file infracost-run.json

# Update the Terraform code by changing the instance type to m5.8xlarge
vim main.tf

# Show cost estimate diff
infracost diff --path . --terraform-parse-hcl --compare-to infracost-run.json
```

Checkout the docs for:
- [`infracost breakdown --terraform-parse-hcl`](https://www.infracost.io/docs/features/cli_commands/#option-1-terraform-directory)
- [`infracost diff --terraform-parse-hcl --compare-to infracost-run.json`](https://www.infracost.io/docs/features/cli_commands/#option-1-terraform-directory-1)

The HCL parsing method will become the default behavior of the `infracost breakdown` and `infracost diff` commands in **v0.10.0** of the CLI. We haven't finalized the interface yet, but it's likely that the `--terraform-parse-hcl` flag will be removed so there will be two main ways to use Infracost:
- Option 1: Terraform directory‚Äã (good for source control systems such as GitHub)
- Option 2: Terraform plan JSON‚Äã (good for deployment systems such as Terraform Cloud)

### Relevant changes:
- feat: Add support for HCL parsing of Terragrunt projects by @tim775 in #1571
- feat: Add support for TF_VAR_ environment variables when parsing HCL by @tim775 in #1586
- feat: Load TFC remote execution variables for HCL parsing by @vdmgolub in #1589
- feat: add compare-to flag to compare diffs across runs by @hugorut in #1570

## New resources
- feat(aws): Add launch template support for Instance resource by @vdmgolub in #1564
- feat(google): Add usage parameter for Compute Address/Global Address by @vdmgolub in #1573

## Fixes
- fix(hcl): evalute modules in order of reference by @hugorut in #1568
- fix: Match on the whole markdown tag when finding existing comments by @tim775 in #1581
- fix: Lookup region from resource_group_name by @tim775 in #1582
- fix: Don't error when using terragrunt dependencies by @tim775 in #1591
- fix(azure): fix public ip standard pricing by @hugorut in #1592
- fix: fix polluting the OS env variables by @aliscott in #1587

## Other improvements
- ci(fig): update autocomplete spec automatically by @fedeci in #1565
- refactor(azure): resource migrations batch 1 by @sinabakh in #1540
- chore(aws): Load EBS block devices from LT for Instance resource by @vdmgolub in #1580

## Docs
https://github.com/infracost/docs/pull/203/files

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.9.22...v0.9.23

name: v0.9.22
body:
## 0.9.22 (April 13 2022)

Infracost **v0.9.22** contains several major fixes for [HCL parsing](https://www.infracost.io/docs/features/cli_commands/#option-3-parse-hcl-directly) as well as support for some heavily requested new resources. Thank you to our amazing community members who helped us diagnose, triage and fix bugs, you rock ‚ù§Ô∏è!

---

### New Features

**AWS**
* SNS Topic notification support - by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1551
* SNS FIFO Topic support - by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1552

**Azure**
* MySQL Flexible Server support - by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1539
* Data Factory support - by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1558

---

### Fixes

* We've continued to improve the accuracy of [HCL parsing](https://www.infracost.io/docs/features/cli_commands/#option-3-parse-hcl-directly). Thanks again to all the community members who reported issues to us.
  * Full support for provider aliases - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1532
  * Fixed various issues with resource `count` attributes - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1548, https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1543, https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1542
  * Solved `google_container_cluster` missing references with existing Terraform state - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1508
  * Set default billing value for `aws_dynamodb_table` - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1521
  * Set default os disk size for `azurerm_kubernetes_cluster_node_pool` - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1531
  * Use `aws_ecs_cluster` launch type from capacity providers if available - by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1533
  * Fixed `aws_kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream` `subnet_ids` attribute resolving as empty before apply - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1544
* Solved incorrect pricing for AWS Step Functions - by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1509

### Other improvements

* Migration of further resources to new internal structure - by @sinabakh in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1470

---

### Docs
* https://github.com/infracost/docs/pull/199

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.9.21...v0.9.22

name: v0.9.21
body:
## 0.9.21 (March 30 2022)

Infracost v0.9.21 contains several new features, general codebase improvements and some bug fixes. Thank you, our awesome community, for making this release possible!

---

### New Features
* We've disabled spinners by default for CI environment, so you are no longer spammed by hundreds of useless log lines! Instead we default the output to use the 'info' log level. You can modify it by setting [this environment variable](https://www.infracost.io/docs/features/environment_variables/#infracost_log_level) - by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1474
* We've added a new `terraform-init-flags` flag to fine tune Terraform usage with Infracost. Here's [an example](https://www.infracost.io/docs/features/cli_commands/#option-1-terraform-directory) how to use it - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1471
* We've clarified usage of `--show-skipped` flag in `breakdown` and `diff` output. When set it will list unsupported and free resources - by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1477

**AWS**
* Network Firewall support - by @ouranos in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1469
* Glue resources support - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1489
* Additional free resources - by @syphernl in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1481

**Google**
* VPC Service Network Connections support - by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1492

**Azure**
* SQL Managed Instance support - by @matthieupetite in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1461
* Mark Storage Container resource as free - by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1499

---

### Fixes

* Since the release of [HCL parsing](https://www.infracost.io/blog/mar-2022-update/#parsing-hcl) feature we keep working to improve its results and resolve the found and reported issues:
  * HCL panic errors - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1475
  * Get the correct instance type for EKS node groups - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1494
  * Use backwards referencess to determine if EIP has been allocated - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1500
  * VPC endpoint's `subnet_ids` attribute empty without apply state - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1504
* Honor cache enabled flag for API Gateway - by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1506

### Other improvements
* Infracost is built with Go v1.18 now - by @PatMyron in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1466
* We've added CodeQL vulnerability scanning for Infracost repositories - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1479
* We are now showing the `terraform-parse-hcl` flag in the CLI's help output now, so more users can discover and try it out - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1473

---

### Docs
* https://github.com/infracost/docs/pull/183
* https://github.com/infracost/docs/pull/193

### New Contributors
* @matthieupetite made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1461
* @ouranos made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1469

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.9.20...v0.9.21

name: v0.9.20
body:
## 0.9.20 (March 16 2022)

**If you are using any of the [CI bash scripts](https://github.com/infracost/infracost/tree/master/scripts/ci), please upgrade as soon as possible**

These scripts have been replaced by dedicated integrations with most CI/CD platforms, which we recommend you upgrading to:

* [GitHub Actions](https://www.infracost.io/docs/guides/actions_migration/)
* [GitLab CI](https://www.infracost.io/docs/guides/gitlab_ci_migration/)
* [Atlantis](https://www.infracost.io/docs/guides/atlantis_migration/)
* [Azure DevOps](https://www.infracost.io/docs/guides/azure_devops_migration/)

Please visit [Infracost.io/cicd](https://www.infracost.io/cicd/) for other CI/CD integrations and more information.

These scripts will be removed **September 2022**. If you are pulling them directly from this repository and cannot upgrade before then, we recommend you keeping a copy in your own repositories.

---

Infracost **v0.9.20** contains some exciting **new features**, general codebase improvements and some bug fixes. Thanks as always to our amazing community who made this release possible.

### New Features
![Github failing policy](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6455139/158605441-981eea5c-1bfe-4d2d-a76b-f7a36e964694.png)

* Cost policy checks are now reported directly inside pull request comments. The native integration with [Open Policy Agent](https://www.openpolicyagent.org/) simplifies writing policies that are checked before resources are launched. Find out more about this exciting feature [on our blog](https://www.infracost.io/blog/native-cost-policies/) - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1289
* Infracost CLI now has [fig](https://fig.io/) autocompletion support - by @fedeci in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1457

**AWS**
* Elastic beanstalk environment support - by @lukeadams84 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1411
* Marks a number of app_autoscaling as free resources - by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1426

**Google**
* GKE Autopilot support for container cluster resource - by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1458

---

### Fixes

* As part of the internal security drive, we made changes to the release workflow to use an internal script - by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1444
* A massive thanks to all the community who helped report issues with our drive to make [parsing HCL a reality](https://www.infracost.io/blog/mar-2022-update/#parsing-hcl). Thanks to you, we resolved a number of issues:
  * Google SQL Database Instance to use default values - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1455
  * `google_container_cluster` duplicating node pools when applied - by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1463
  * Set engine for AWS DB Instance replica - by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1438
  * Set default capacity for Azure App Service Plan - by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1435
* Resolved issue where slack message above a project count > 3 were causing errors with the API - @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1462
* `Infracost comment` has better error reporting if communication issues arise between the GitHub API and Infracost - by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1443
* Internal changes to the Infracost CLI to support our new resource structure - by @sinabakh in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1376

---

### Docs

https://github.com/infracost/docs/pull/177

### New Contributors

* @lukeadams84 made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1411
* @fedeci made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1457

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.9.19...v0.9.20

name: v0.9.19
body:
## What's Changed

### New Features/resources

* Add HCL-only provider by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1303, 
Infracost can parse the Terraform HCL code directly without having to generate a plan JSON. This is useful if you want to run Infracost without having access to the Terraform binary or any cloud credentials that Terraform requires. It is also faster than generating a plan JSON. see [usage docs](https://www.infracost.io/docs/guides/advanced_usage/#parsing-hcl-experimental)

* Add zip archives to release by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1389, see the [release page](https://github.com/infracost/infracost/releases) for the files

* On release trigger chocolatey-packages workflow by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1398, Windows users can now just run `choco install infracost` or `choco upgrade infracost`

New AWS resources:
* Add aws_appautoscaling_target resource by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1401
* Add application autoscaling support for AWS MSK clusters by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1408
* Add application autoscaling support for ElastiCache replication groups by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1409

### Enhancements

* Log out-file message if log-level is set by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1383
* Use simple prompts for register commands on Windows by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1388
* Update filter for google_container_node_pool resource by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1394
* Remove emoji from basic Markdown template by @lazzurs in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1402
* Change styling of output URLs by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1404

### Docs

* https://github.com/infracost/docs/pull/168

### Fixes

* Add run time values into singular attribute by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1412
* Validate PR/MR number in comment commands by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1391

## New Contributors
* @lazzurs made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1402

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.9.18...v0.9.19

name: v0.9.18
body:
## What's Changed

### New Features/resources

* Add Linux ARM 64 releases by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1318
* Add SHA checksum to binaries by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1351
* Add commenting for Bitbucket by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1363
  - see `infracost comment bitbucket --help` for an example of how to post cost estimates to Bitbucket Cloud/Server, or see the [docs here](https://www.infracost.io/docs/features/cli_commands/#bitbucket)
  - see `infracost output` to generate the comment markdown (so you can post it manually)
* Add support for Bitbucket Server to diff script by @wahlfeld10x in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1269
* Add support for Amazon RDS Performance Insights charges. by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1369
* Add support for additional AWS burstable instance type by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1365
* Add free resources for AWS EFS and Lambda by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1350
* Add support for Premium Azure Event Hubs by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1355
* Add support for Azure log analytics workspace by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1367

### Enhancements

* Migration of old resources to new internal structure @sinabakh, @aliscott and @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1310, https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1338, https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1313, https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1309
* Add support for terraform-provider-aws v4 by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1370

### Docs

* Generate share links for comment command by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1343
* Change register prompts by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1345

### Fixes

* Do no show CI/CD info message for output/comment cmds in CI by @vdmgolub in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1337
* Handle missing `sku.size` for `azurerm_app_service_plan` by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1366
* Fix sync-usage-file failing on S3 if some permissions aren't set by @aliscott in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1368
* Fix uncaught panics from parallel processing by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1371
* Update AWS data transfer filters to match pricing data changes. by @tim775 in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1352
* Solve issue where combined output has double diff monthly total by @hugorut in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1347

## New Contributors

* @wahlfeld10x made their first contribution in https://github.com/infracost/infracost/pull/1269

**Full Changelog**: https://github.com/infracost/infracost/compare/v0.9.17...v0.9.18
